title: Bug 13725 - Revert is much slower than close and reopen in Java editor
description: Bug 13725 - Revert is much slower than close and reopen in Java editor.
OB: When attempting to revert the file contents in the Java editor, the process takes significantly longer compared to simply closing and reopening the file.
EB: This seems unusual, as the revert operation should not be slower than closing and reopening the file.
SR:
1. Open a Java file in the editor.
2. Make some changes to the file.
3. Select the 'Revert' option from the File menu.
4. Observe the time it takes for the file contents to be reverted.
5. Close the file.
6. Reopen the file.
7. Compare the time taken for reverting and closing/reopening the file.
